Requirements: Students applying for admission must complete the free online application and submit their official high school transcript. Students with an unweighted high school GPA of 2.5 or higher are not required to submit an ACT or SAT score for admission consideration.

What We Require for Admission:

1. Completed application for admission (it’s free to apply online).
2. Official high school transcript.
3. Official ACT or SAT scores. (Note – Midway University is test-optional and does not require a test score for admission but may be used for placement or scholarship consideration.)
Applicants must submit official high school transcript or official GED scores. If you have earned college credit, please have all official transcripts sent to Midway University.

To be considered for admission, prospective students should follow these steps: 1. Submit an Application for Admission online. 2. Submit your official high school transcript. We can also accept an unofficial transcript for an admission decision but will require an official transcript for enrollment. 3. Submit your official ACT and/or SAT scores. Midway University is a test-optional institution for students with a 2.5 or higher high school GPA.

Complete the online application for admission. Submit an official high school transcript or GED scores. Submit official ACT or SAT scores. (Midway University is test-optional. Students with a 2.5 GPA or higher do not have to submit ACT or SAT test scores for general admission into the University.) Submit official college transcripts from all institutions attended (if applicable).

To be considered for admission, students must submit the following: a completed application for admission (there is no application fee), official high school transcript or GED scores, and official college transcripts from all institutions attended (if applicable). High school graduates must have a minimum high school GPA of 2.0. GED students must have a minimum GED score of 450. Transfer students must have a minimum 2.0 GPA on all previous college work.

Completed application for admission (no application fee). Official high school transcript or official GED scores. Official ACT or SAT scores. Midway University is test-optional for students who have a 2.5 GPA or higher.

To apply for graduate admission, students must submit a completed online application and official transcripts from all institutions attended. Program specific requirements include: Bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited institution; An undergraduate GPA of 2.5 on a 4.0 scale or a 3.0 on a 4.0 scale on the last 60 hours of undergraduate coursework; A current resume; Three letters of recommendation; A statement of purpose (no more than two pages) addressing the following: 1. Your coaching/sport leadership philosophy and career aspirations; 2. What you hope to gain from the MS-CSL program.

To be considered for admission, students must submit a completed online application for admission, official high school transcript, and official ACT or SAT scores. Midway University is test-optional. Students who have a 2.5 GPA or higher can be admitted without test scores.

Midway University has a test-optional admission policy for incoming freshmen students. Application Requirements for First-Time Freshmen: Completed online application; Official High School Transcript; Official ACT or SAT scores (optional); Personal Essay/Statement (optional).

Students seeking admission to Midway University as a first-time freshman must submit the following: Application for Admission, an official high school transcript showing a cumulative GPA of 2.5 or higher, and official ACT and/or SAT scores (optional). Midway University is test optional for admissions.

Admission to the Teacher Education Program is a separate process from admission to Midway University. Students must meet the following criteria to be admitted into the Teacher Education Program:

- Complete an application for admission to the Teacher Education Program.
- Achieve a minimum overall GPA of 2.75 on a 4.0 scale.
- Complete a minimum of 45 semester credit hours of coursework.
- Complete ENG 101, ENG 102, COM 101, and MA 110 (or MA 115) with a grade of C or better.
- Achieve passing scores on the PRAXIS Core Academic Skills for Educators (CASE) exams: Reading, Writing, and Mathematics OR have an ACT composite score of 21 or higher.
- Complete a formal interview.
- Complete an autobiographical essay.
- Submit three (3) letters of recommendation.
- Provide documentation of 200 hours of experience with school-age children.
- Submit a signed Code of Ethics/Character and Fitness form.
- Receive a positive recommendation from Teacher Education Program faculty.

Application Requirements for First-Time Freshmen: Completed application for admission; Official high school transcript with a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.50 OR a GED score of 450 (45 prior to 2002). Students with a GPA between 2.0 and 2.49 may be considered for conditional admission; Official ACT or SAT scores with a minimum 18 composite ACT OR 960 SAT (ERW+M). Students with an ACT score between 16-17 or SAT between 880-950 (ERW+M) may be considered for conditional admission.

Teacher Education Program Admission Requirements: Upon completion of the first 45 credit hours, students may apply for admission into the Teacher Education program. This requires a 2.75 GPA, passing scores on the PRAXIS CORE exam and a formal interview.

General freshman admission requires an online application and official high school transcript. Submission of official ACT or SAT scores is required for students with a high school GPA below 2.5; Midway University is test-optional for students with a 2.5 or higher GPA. For students submitting scores, a recommended ACT composite is 18 or an SAT of 960 (ERW+M). Formal admission into the Teacher Education program itself occurs after university matriculation and requires a minimum 2.75 overall GPA, passing scores on the PRAXIS Core Academic Skills for Educators exams (or an ACT composite score of 22 or higher), a formal application, an interview, and a signed Professional Code of Ethics for Kentucky School Personnel.
Program name: Middle School Education - English (Area of Emphasis)

Requirements: Complete our free, online application. Submit your official high school transcript showing a cumulative GPA of 2.0 or higher (on a 4.0 scale). Submit your official ACT or SAT scores. Midway is test-optional for students with a 2.5 or higher high school GPA. If you have earned college credit while in high school, have official transcripts from each institution sent to Midway University.
Program name: Middle School Education - Math (Area of Emphasis)

Requirements: Submit your official high school transcript. Submit your official ACT or SAT scores. Midway University is currently test-optional. Students who have a 2.5 or higher high school GPA can be admitted without test scores.
Program name: Middle School Education - Science (Area of Emphasis)

Requirements: Complete our FREE online application. Submit your official high school transcript. Midway University is test-optional. If you choose to submit test scores, have your official ACT or SAT scores sent directly to Midway.
Program name: Middle School Education - Social Studies (Area of Emphasis)

Requirements:
To apply for admissions as a first-time freshman students should follow these steps:
1. Complete the online application.
2. Submit an official high school transcript or GED scores.
3. Submit official ACT or SAT scores.

To be admitted to the Teacher Education program, students will submit a formal application which requires a cumulative GPA of 2.75 on a 4.0 scale, a signed Professional Code of Ethics for Kentucky School Personnel, documentation of a clear criminal record check, a formal writing sample, and passing scores on the Praxis Core Academic Skills for Educators test (Reading, Writing, and Math) or ACT/SAT equivalent scores.

All students must submit an application for admission. First-time freshmen requirements include: Completed online application, Official high school transcript or GED scores, Official ACT or SAT scores. Midway University is currently test optional for students who have a 2.5 GPA or higher.

1. Complete our free, online application. 2. Submit your official high school transcript... 3. Submit your official ACT or SAT scores. Midway University is currently test-optional for students with a 2.5 GPA or higher. Scores can be sent directly from ACT or College Board. Midway’s school code for ACT is 1528 and for SAT is 1467. 4. Submit official college transcripts from all institutions attended (if applicable).

To apply for admissions, students need to submit the following: Online Application; Official high school transcript or GED scores. Midway University is test-optional for students with a 2.5 or higher high school GPA. Some programs may still require test scores for admissions into the program. The Education Studies program does not list a separate test score requirement.

Complete an application for admission. Request official high school transcript or GED be sent to the Admissions Office. An ACT or SAT score is not required for admission but can be submitted for scholarship consideration. A minimum 2.0 cumulative high school GPA is required for unconditional admission.

Application for Admission – Free online application
Official High School Transcript
ACT/SAT Scores – Midway University is a test optional institution. Students are not required to submit ACT/SAT scores for admission consideration. For those who choose to submit them our school codes are ACT: 1530 and SAT: 1467.

For full acceptance, students must meet two of the following three criteria: 2.5 High School GPA (on a 4.0 scale); 18 ACT Composite Score; 960 SAT Composite Score. Midway University has a test optional admission policy. Students applying for Education Studies can choose if they want to submit ACT or SAT scores as part of their admission application.

To apply for admission as a first-time freshman, students will need to complete the free online application, submit their official high school transcript, and submit their ACT or SAT scores (optional).

Complete our FREE online application. Request that your official high school transcript, GED scores, or official college transcripts from all institutions attended be sent to the Office of Admissions. Midway University is a test-optional institution. Students can submit their ACT or SAT scores if they feel it will strengthen their application but it is not required for admission.

To apply for admission as a First-Time Freshman, students need to submit the following: Completed application for admission (there is no application fee); Official high school transcript; Official ACT or SAT scores (Midway is test optional for students who meet GPA requirements). An official high school transcript or GED scores should be sent directly to the Office of Admissions. Midway University requires a minimum of a 2.0 cumulative grade point average (on a 4.0 scale) for admission. Some majors do have higher GPA requirements.
Complete the Midway University undergraduate application. Submit your official high school transcript or GED. Submit your ACT or SAT scores. (See our Test Optional Policy for details).

Completed online application for admission, Official high school transcript, Official ACT and/or SAT scores (Midway is test optional for students with a 2.5 GPA and above), Official transcripts from all colleges/universities attended (if any).

To be admitted to Midway University, you must be a graduate of an accredited high school with a minimum of a 2.0 GPA or have a GED. Students should submit their official transcript from high school or their official GED scores. Midway University is a test-optional institution. Students can submit their ACT/SAT scores if they wish to have them reviewed with their application.

All applicants must complete the free online application or the Common App and submit an official high school transcript or official GED scores. Official transcripts from any and all previously attended colleges/universities are also required. Midway University is test-optional, meaning students are not required to submit an ACT or SAT score for admission.
Complete the online application. Submit official high school transcripts. Submit official ACT or SAT scores (Midway is test-optional for students with a 2.5 or higher GPA).

As 'Health Service Preparatory Studies' is a pre-professional track and not a major, students must apply for general undergraduate admission. To be considered for admission, students should submit the following: a completed online application, an official high school transcript, and official ACT/SAT test scores (optional).

Midway University has a rolling admissions policy. Students should apply as early as possible to ensure consideration for their intended term of entry and for scholarships. To be admitted to Midway University, students must submit the following:
1. Completed application for admission. You can apply online for free.
2. Official high school transcript with a cumulative GPA of 2.0 or higher or official GED scores.
3. Official ACT or SAT scores. Midway University is a test-optional institution.

Complete the free online application and submit your official high school transcript. Midway University has a test optional admission policy, meaning students are not required to submit an ACT or SAT score for admission review. Students with a 2.5 GPA or higher are admitted outright. Students with a 2.0-2.49 GPA are admitted with conditions.

Applicants must complete an online application and submit official high school transcripts or official GED scores. Midway University is test-optional for students with a high school GPA of 2.5 or higher. Submission of ACT or SAT scores is required for admission review for students with a GPA between 2.00-2.49.

Midway University reviews applications on a rolling basis. Once we receive your application and all required documents, we will notify you of your admissions decision. Required documents include:

Completed online application
Official High School Transcript
Official ACT/SAT Scores (optional)

Midway University has a test-optional admission policy. That means we don’t require you to submit an ACT or SAT score for admission. Here are the steps to follow to apply for admission.

1. Complete the Online Application
2. Submit your official high school transcript
3. Submit your official ACT or SAT scores (optional)
4. Submit official transcripts from any and all colleges/universities attended (if applicable)

To be considered for admission, students should submit: Completed online application, Official high school transcript, Official ACT or SAT scores. Midway University is a test-optional institution. Students with an unweighted GPA of 2.5 or higher do not have to submit test scores.

To be admitted to the university to pursue a minor, prospective students must submit a completed online application (either the Midway University application or the Common App) and an official high school transcript with a minimum 2.5 unweighted GPA or GED scores. Submission of ACT or SAT scores is optional for students with a 2.5 GPA or higher.

To apply for admission, students need to: complete the online application for admission, submit an official high school transcript or official GED scores, and submit official ACT or SAT scores. Midway University is test-optional.

To apply for admission as a first-time freshman, please submit the following: Completed online application, Official High School Transcript, Official ACT or SAT scores*. *Midway University is currently test-optional. Students with a 2.5 GPA or higher are not required to submit test scores. Students who do not meet the 2.5 GPA requirement may be required to submit test scores.

Prospective students must complete a free online application and submit official high school transcripts or a GED. Midway University is a test-optional institution, so submission of ACT or SAT scores is not required for admission consideration.

To be admitted to the Music Minor with a Performance Track, students will perform an entrance audition for the music faculty during the first week of classes of their first semester in which they declare the minor. The music faculty will help each student find their track of study.

Phase I – Midway University Admissions Requirements:
Admission to Midway University as a Pre-Nursing Student (must be completed by February 1).
Submit all official college transcripts to the Midway University Registrar’s Office.
Minimum GPA of 2.5 on a 4.0 scale from the last institution attended.

Phase II – ADN Program Admissions Requirements:
Application to the ADN Program (must be submitted by February 1).
Must have a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.5 on a 4.0 scale on all previous college work.
A minimum grade of “C” is required in each science and nursing support course.
Take the required Pre-Admission Entrance Exam (ATI TEAS).
An ATI TEAS score of Proficient Level is the required minimum to be considered for admission into the ADN program.
All prerequisite courses must be completed by the end of the spring semester of the application year.

Students can be admitted to Midway University as pre-nursing students throughout the year. Admission to the University does not guarantee admission into the nursing program. Admission into the nursing program major is competitive. Meeting the minimum requirements does not guarantee admission into the program. The following are the minimum requirements for consideration for admission into the nursing program:

Admission to Midway University.
Completion of the Nursing Program Application by the published deadline.
A minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale on all college work attempted.
A minimum science GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale on all science courses attempted.
Completion of prerequisite courses with a grade of 'C' or better in each course prior to beginning the nursing program.
Completion of the Test of Essential Academic Skills (TEAS) with a minimum overall score of 65% and a minimum of 65% on the reading and math sections.
Submission of two (2) professional references. One must be from a college professor and the other from a current or previous employer/supervisor. Both references must be submitted via the online reference form.
Submission of a written essay. This is a personal statement written at the time of the program application in response to a provided prompt.
Interview with nursing faculty.

Admission to Midway University as a degree seeking student (this is a separate process from admission to the nursing program).
A completed application for admission to the Midway University ADN or BSN Program.
Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended with a minimum GPA of 2.5 on all undergraduate coursework attempted.
An unencumbered, active license to practice as a registered nurse in the United States.
Evidence of good academic and social standing at the last institution attended.
Students must complete all general education requirements and cognate courses with a “C” or better. Students must have an overall GPA of 2.5 on a 4.0 scale on all undergraduate coursework.

Application for admission; Baccalaureate degree with a major in nursing (BSN) from a professionally (ACEN or CCNE) accredited program; Minimum undergraduate cumulative grade point average of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale; Official transcripts from all previous college work; Unencumbered, current Registered Nurse license in the state where the student will complete all clinical coursework; Three letters of reference; Resume; An essay (500-1000 words) addressing a significant contemporary issue in nursing and health care; Successful completion of an undergraduate statistics course with a grade of C or better.

Complete graduate application for admission. Submit official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended. Possess a cumulative undergraduate grade point average (GPA) of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Have completed a Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) degree from an ACEN or CCNE accredited nursing program. Possess an unrestricted and unencumbered license as a Registered Nurse in the state where the student will be completing their clinical and practicum hours. Submit a professional resume. Submit a professional essay that addresses the prompts: Describe your professional career goals and how the completion of the MSN degree will help you accomplish these goals. Describe the qualities you possess that would make you a good advanced practice nurse. Explain how your prior nursing experiences have prepared you for graduate school. Submit three (3) professional or academic letters of reference. Have completed an undergraduate statistics course with a grade of C or better.

To pursue the Physical Education teaching track, students must be formally admitted to the Teacher Education Program (TEP) after admission to the university. Requirements for TEP admission include: completing an application for admission to the TEP, submitting a Dispositions Self-Assessment Form, having a cumulative GPA of 2.75 or higher, achieving passing scores on the Core Academic Skills for Educators (CASE) exams, completing specific introductory courses with a 'C' or better, submitting three faculty recommendations, and completing a successful interview with the Teacher Education Committee.

Completed online application for admission; Official high school transcript or GED scores. A final, official transcript showing date of graduation is required for enrollment; Official ACT or SAT scores. Midway University is test-optional for students who have an unweighted GPA of 2.5 or higher. Students admitted under the test-optional policy will be required to take a placement exam to determine course placement.

All students must submit an official high school transcript or official GED scores. We also will need your official ACT or SAT scores. Students who are 24 years of age or older or have more than 24 college credit hours are not required to submit test scores. Regular admission to the University is offered to students who meet the following criteria: High School GPA of 2.0 or higher AND an ACT composite score of 18 or higher or SAT of 960 or higher. Students who do not meet the regular admission requirements can be reviewed for test optional admission. Students will submit an essay and resume along with their transcripts. Items will be reviewed by the Admissions Committee.

All applicants must submit a completed application for admission. Applicants must also submit an official high school transcript or official GED scores, and official college transcript(s) from all institutions attended (if applicable). Midway University is test optional for students with a 2.5 or higher high school GPA. Some programs and scholarships may still require test scores for admission.

Complete an online application. Request that your official high school transcript be sent to the Office of Admissions. Request that your official ACT or SAT scores be sent to the Office of Admissions. Midway’s CEEB code is 1508 for SAT and 1530 for ACT. Students are admitted on a rolling basis throughout the year. Students with a 2.5 or higher high school GPA will be admitted to the University. Students with a 2.0-2.49 high school GPA can be admitted on a conditional basis. Test Optional – Midway University is a test optional institution for students with an unweighted 2.5 GPA or higher. We encourage all students to submit a test score for scholarship consideration.

Complete an online application for admission. Submit an official high school transcript or official GED scores. Midway University is a test-optional institution. Students can submit their ACT or SAT scores if they feel it will strengthen their application but it is not required for admission review. Students are considered for admission with an unweighted high school GPA of 2.0 or higher. Students with a GPA lower than 2.0 will be reviewed by the Admissions Committee and may be offered conditional admission.

To be considered for admission, students need to submit: 1. A completed application for admission. 2. An official high school transcript or official GED scores. 3. Official ACT or SAT scores. (Midway University is a test-optional institution. If a student has a high school GPA of 2.5 or higher their test scores are not required for admissions. Students with a GPA below 2.5 are required to submit ACT or SAT scores to be considered for admission.)

To be considered for admission as a first-time freshman, students must submit the following: Completed Application for Admission (no fee); Official high school transcript or GED scores; Official ACT or SAT scores. Test scores are optional for students with a 2.5 cumulative high school GPA or higher.
